title: Montana becomes 1st state to approve a full ban of TikTok
description: Montana's bill goes farther than bans in nearly half of the states that target devices on state-issued devices. Instead, Montana's legislation makes it illegal for anyone to download TikTok.

title: Lori Vallow Daybell's 'zombie' murder trial has brought a string of notable moments
description: The jury has heard testimony from Vallow Daybell's close friend, along with relatives and investigators, in the long-awaited "zombie" murder trial.

title: Supreme Court issues a temporary stay in the Texas mifepristone case
description: The U.S. Supreme Court has issued an administrative stay in a Texas case involving limited access to the abortion drug mifepristone.

title: The book ban fight is intensifying in Llano, Texas
description: NPR's Andrew Limbong talks with Tina Castelan, a former librarian for the Llano County Library System in Texas, about the continuing fight over certain titles on the library's shelves.

title: The suspected leaker of Pentagon documents left a long trail of digital breadcrumbs
description: The federal government is charging Jack Texiera with leaking classified documents online. He faced a judge for the first time this morning.

title: NYC is waging a war against rats. Meet the woman leading the charge
description: The rats don't run this city! Allegedly.

title: Ukraine hopes to rally world leaders to help fund its reconstruction
description: Ukraine needs billions of dollars for reconstruction. Its prime minister is in Washington, D.C., this week meeting finance ministers and government officials from around the world, asking for help.

title: The latest on the leaked classified documents
description: The 21-year-old Air National Guardsman accused of leaking a trove of U.S. intelligence documents is facing charges under the espionage act. He made his initial court appearance today.

title: The Taliban again bans Afghan women aid workers. Here's how the U.N. responded
description: The Taliban has banned Afghan women working for the U.N. or other aid agencies. The repercussions could be devastating for programs in which women play a vital role.

title: U.S. charges El Chapo's sons and other Sinaloa cartel members in fentanyl trafficking
description: Members of the Mexican cartel are facing several charges involving fentanyl trafficking, weapons and money laundering in New York, Illinois and Washington, D.C.

title: Remembering restaurant critic and food writer Mimi Sheraton
description: Sheraton, who died April 6, was the first woman to review restaurants for The New York Times. Her opinions were reputed to have the power to make or break new restaurants. Originally broadcast in '87.

title: Seeing a red flag warning in your weather app? Here's what to do
description: Red flag warnings mean an increased risk of wildfires in the next 12 to 24 hours, so fire safety is extra important. How do they differ from fire weather watches? And what precautions should you take?

title: What we know about Jack Teixeira, the suspected leaker of Pentagon documents
description: Jack Teixeira, a 21-year-old member of the Massachusetts Air National Guard, allegedly posted classified documents on a private Discord channel where users were fascinated by guns and racist memes.

title: A robot answers questions about health. Its creators just won a $2.25 million prize
description: At the Skoll World Forum this week, South Africa's Reach Digital Health was one of five honorees. They offer health advice via mobile phones to millions, focusing on pregnancy, babies and COVID.

title: DOJ asks Supreme Court to intervene in case that limits access to abortion drug
description: The Justice Department is looking to reinstate full access to mifespristone after an appeal to the Fifth Circuit resulted in access with limitations.

title: Suspected leaker of secret Pentagon documents arraigned in Massachusetts
description: A federal judge in Boston has ordered Jack Teixeira, the 21-year-old member of the Massachusetts Air National Guard, to remain in custody until his detention hearing next week.

title: Minneapolis awards $8.9 million to 2 people claiming Derek Chauvin kneeled on them
description: Chauvin has pleaded guilty to charges stemming from claims he kneeled on a teenager's neck in 2017, while he is accused of kneeling on a woman's neck earlier in that year.

title: Separating climate change and inequality won't work, says Biden's World Bank nominee
description: Ajay Banga, the next nominee to lead the World Bank, says it will take trillions of dollars of investment and global partnerships to meet the world's challenges.

title: Need to charge your phone? Think twice — "juice jackers" might come for you
description: "Juice Jacking" has become so prevalent that the FBI is now warning the public about it.

title: Why New Mexico has one of the top rates for killings by police
description: A shooting last week in Farmington, N.M., where police went to the wrong house and killed a man, is just the latest example of lethal force being used against civilians in the state.

title: Here's what really happened during the abortion drug's approval 23 years ago
description: A Texas judge ruled that the Food and Drug Administration wrongly approved mifepristone in 2000 and accused it of doing a rush job. Here's what really went down.

title: Pierce was lying on the road after being hit by a car. A stranger saved him
description: When Pierce Forde was hit by a car while riding his motorcycle in the 1990s, a stranger stayed by his side. Forde says he wouldn't be alive without that man's help.

title: The math behind Dominion Voting System's $1.6 billion lawsuit against Fox News
description: If Dominion prevails in its massive defamation suit against Fox News, a big challenge for the voting tech company will be to demonstrate that it deserves more than $1 billion in damages.

title: The pharmaceutical industry urges courts to preserve access to abortion pill
description: As the debate over mifepristone makes its way to the Supreme Court, the pharmaceutical industry has raised concerns that ruling against the FDA could chill the development of new drugs.

title: You're less likely to get long COVID after a second infection than a first
description: The chances of developing lingering symptoms after COVID appears to fall sharply from the first to the second time someone gets sick, new research finds. The risk is still significant.

title: What could make a hoax call reporting a school shooting worse? Social media
description: NPR has documented an alarming pattern of hoax school shooting calls across the country. Now another pattern has emerged: bad actors using these moments to spread misinformation online.

title: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis signs bill banning abortion after 6 weeks of pregnancy
description: The ban gives Gov. DeSantis a key political victory among Republican primary voters as he prepares to launch a presidential candidacy built on his national brand as a conservative standard bearer.

title: North Korea tests a powerful new kind of missile
description: North Korea has successfully tested a solid-fueled ICBM, a type of missile that can be launched far more quickly than its current ones.
